sub_title: Customer Experience Leader, Service Parts Supply Chain at Philips
summary:
PMP and IASSC Certified Black Belt Lean Six Sigma with a Master of Business Administration, and demonstrated experience in Supply Chain and Finance.
Skilled in Project Management, Lean and Six Sigma Tools and Techniques,  Problem Solving, Analytical Skills, Data Analysis, Financial reporting, Account Reconciliation.

awards.description: Recognition from the Leadership team in Philips for leading the project that resulted in improved replenishment strategy in Philips. The strategy had all 3 winning aspects: 200.000 Eur savings for logistic costs, 200.000 Eur savings for Stock Investment, and 0.5% Improve rate on on-time delivery to the customer.

awards.title: Recognition for Role Model Behavior 2017
awards.description: Rewarded by AccOps Leadership Team for managing responding teams (Infosys, Local country representatives, Third Party Service providers) and responding to the audit requirements for France on a short note, despite being on a leave at that time, in order to avoid delays in the audit and potential liabilities for Philips.

awards.title: Kaizen of the month 2017
awards.description: Philips was facing penalties due to late payments of Foreign VAT amounts to the Tax authorities. Via Kaizen event the waste in the process was eliminated by harmonizing the steps, making a standard payment template, and linked the payment to an Invoice template. The improvement resulted in on-time payments on the account of Tax Authorities abroad, standardized way of working, no open items on GL account, and clear rules regarding responsibilities.

projects.title: Implementation plan for Indirect Tax within Blueheart Project
projects.description:
Implementation plan for future testing phases, for Indirect Tax within the Blueheart project. (The Blueheart project is mainly focused on migration of the data from one SAP system into another).
The project was a case study on the previous migrations of one SAP system to another. It analyzed the current way of working, the process steps, defined the problem and root cause for it, and pointed the waste in the process steps. The new proposed solution consisted of a implementation plan with end to end view of the Indirect Tax Process, clear roles and responsibilities for all parties involved in the process and clear instruction for the next implementations.
Used: 3C, 5Why, VSM, SIPOC, RACI, PRIDE, Fishbone Diagram, PDCA, Poka-yoke, KJ Method.

contributors.headline: Customer Experience Leader, Service Parts Supply Chain at Philips
Group Leader Lean Six Sigma, Operational Excellence, dsm-firmenich

projects.title: The power of Lean and Lean Organisation
projects.description:
Promoting Lean tools and techniques in the Indirect Tax team, by taking running operational issue (in the team) that had a risk of not reaching the predefined deadline, for analyzes. The analyze included: Identifying the root cause of the problem, mapping the current way of working, identifying the waste and  eliminating it. The result was positive and allowed the team to reach the deadline - first time right.
The next phase was presentation of the whole problem statement in End to End thinking phase so the team can understand better the power of the Lean methodology and learn new tools and techniques.
Used: 3C, 5Why, Takt time, Andon Cord, VSM, PRIDE, Kaizen, TIM WOODS, PDCA, SIPOC, RACI, KJ Method.

contributors.headline: Customer Experience Leader, Service Parts Supply Chain at Philips
Group Leader Lean Six Sigma, Operational Excellence, dsm-firmenich

projects.title: Payment Template for Foreign VAT amounts to the Tax Authorities.
projects.description:
The issue we faced were penalties due to late payments of Foreign VAT amounts to the Tax authorities. Via Kaizen event, we managed to eliminate the waste in the process by harmonizing the steps, made standard payment template, and linked the payment to an invoice template with ICC code for direct booking on correct GL account and ICA invoicing. That resulted in on-time payments on the account of Tax Authorities abroad, standardized way of working, no open items on GL account, and clear rules regarding responsibilities. The Kaizen was recognized as Kaizen of the month of AccOps for January 2017 and was published on the Social cast.
Used; A3, 3C, 5Why, SIPOC, VSM, PDCA, KJ Method, Kaizen, Poka-yoke.

contributors.headline: Customer Experience Leader, Service Parts Supply Chain at Philips

projects.title: Wrongly booked  Invoices
projects.description:
The project “Wrongly Booked UPS Invoices for Philips France” was together with Supply Chain Management. The project was initiated following an investigation  regarding wrongly booked invoices on AP side. Following the Five-Times Why Lean Methodology, it showed that the problem was deeper than just wrongly booked invoices and it was discovered that amounts were booked to costs instead of being declared into the VAT declaration. The issue was timely resolved and we managed to recover the funds. Furthermore, I also initiated a process improvement validating all UPS invoices for all countries in EMEA in order to ensure such errors does not appear in other countries. 
Used: A3, 3C, 5Why, PDCA, SIPOC, RACI, KJ Method.

contributors.headline: Customer Experience Leader, Service Parts Supply Chain at Philips

projects.title: One Source Implementation
projects.description: Implementation of One Source (Tool for simplification of the Indirect Taxes reporting) within Philips. The project had a goal of standardizing the whole Indirect Tax reporting process across EMEA through continuous improvement. The main challenges were the different legal and fiscal requirements per country and the different way of working in each country internally in Philips. The outcome was a standard way of working for all EMEA countries with defined set of controls that has to be executed.

contributors.headline: Customer Experience Leader, Service Parts Supply Chain at Philips
Manager Accounting at Aspen Pharma Oss

projects.title: Global Internal Control Training (~300 Employees)
projects.description: Preparing and presenting mandatory Global Internal control training for all Philips Employees working with Indirect Tax. The training was together with Group Tax, Internal Control and AccOps and it addressed the processes, the related risks and the activities that needs to be performed under those controls.

profile_positions.description:
I was responsible for ensuring all Customer Program related costs (rebates,co-op marketing) are dealt quickly and efficiently and that costs are paid out or credited in a timely manner. 
Reconciling AP and AR ledgers, Monthly accrual entries and reconciliation of EMEA customer accruals. I was working together with all areas of the business: Accounts Receivable, Account Payable, General Ledger, Claims, Data Integrity, Sales and Finance in order to improve the satisfaction of the customer by increasing the level of service to both customers and the business.
profile_positions.title: Customer Program Associate

profile_positions.description: I was responsible for month end closing in terms of completed reconciliations, periodic controls of the sub ledger and general ledger systems, identifying weak points in the process and suggesting improvements.

profile_positions.description:
Project: Market Research Plan – Graduation Project (in English)
Responsible for researching the market in Dubai with the possibility of Effect Neon to enter the market. The report analyzes the problem both from the aspect of the company, by
providing an internal analysis using the MMOF model, and from the aspect of the market, by providing external analysis using macro, meso, customer, competitor and SWOT analysis.
